resources.string: Laksa is a popular spicy noodle soup in the Peranakan cuisine, which is a combination of Chinese and Malay cuisine.\n\n
It can be found in Malaysia, Singapore, Indonesia and Southern Thailand.
Nasi lemak is a Malay fragrant rice dish cooked in coconut milk and pandan leaf.\n\n
"It is commonly found in Malaysia, where it is considered the national dish.\n\n"
"It is also popular in neighbouring areas such as Singapore;"
" Riau Islands, Brunei, and Southern Thailand."
Kompia or kompyang, is a bread product originates from Fuzhou, the capital city of Fujian Province of China.
Kuih Tepubg Pelita is a type of cake traditionally hearty and tasty.\n\n
It is a type of flour cakes are sweet but not durable.
